unnormalised: New Delhi: The Delhi High Court recently issued a notice in a case concerning alleged copyright infringement related to a popular Bollywood song. The suit, filed by XYZ Music, alleges that ABC Productions used substantial portions of their copyrighted musical work in a recently released film, without obtaining the necessary licenses. According to Adv. Sharma, representing XYZ Music, the unauthorized use constitutes a clear violation of the Copyright Act, 1957.

unnormalised: The plaintiffs are seeking an injunction to restrain ABC Productions from further distribution and exploitation of the film, as well as damages amounting to Rs. 50 lakh.
